text: Psalm 85
Hope in God’s Future Help

For the \add music\add* director. Of the sons of Korah. A psalm.\f + \fr Ps 85 \ft The Hebrew Bible counts the superscription as the first verse of the psalm; the English verse number is reduced by one \f*
O Yahweh, you favored your land.
You restored the fortunes\f + \fr 85:1 \ft Or “captivity” \f* of Jacob.
You took away the guilt\f + \fr 85:2 \ft Or “You forgave the iniquity” \f* of your people;
you covered all their sin. \qs Selah\qs*
You withdrew all your wrath;
you turned from your burning anger.
Restore us, O God of our salvation,
and annul your vexation with us.
Will you be angry against us forever?
Will you prolong your anger generation after generation?
Will you not again revive us,
that your people might rejoice in you?
Show us, O Yahweh, your loyal love,
and grant us your salvation.
I will hear what God, Yahweh, will speak,
because he will speak peace
to his people, even his faithful \add ones\add*,\f + \fr 85:8 \ft Hebrew “and to his faithful” \f*
but let them not return to folly.
Surely his salvation \add is\add* near for those who fear him,
that glory may abide in our land.
Loyal love and faithfulness\f + \fr 85:10 \ft Or “truth” \f* will meet one another;
righteousness and peace will kiss.
Faithfulness\f + \fr 85:11 \ft Or “Truth” \f* will sprout from \add the\add* ground,
and righteousness will look down from heaven.
Yes, Yahweh will give \add what is\add* good,
and our land will give its produce.
Righteousness will go before him,
and it will make his steps a pathway.
